title: Patrick Bamford set to join Norwich City on loan from Chelsea for rest of the season
title_page: Patrick Bamford set to join Norwich City on loan from Chelsea for rest of the season  | Daily Mail Online
text:
Patrick Bamford is poised to join Norwich City on loan for the rest of the season after being given the go-ahead from Chelsea.
The striker failed to score while on loan at Crystal Palace during the first half of this campaign, after impressing at Middlesbrough last season.
The deal for 22-year-old Bamford comes as Chinese side Jiangsu Suning show an interest in signing Chelsea's Radamel Falcao, after signing Ramires.

Falcao's situation will be discussed over the next day with Jiangsu, the side that signed Ramires for £25m, looking to add another big name
Offers are also on the table for Loic Remy but Chelsea do not wish to be left short of cover.
Chelsea's young Belgian Charly Musonda is joining Real Betis on an initial six-month loan though the Spanish side would like an 18-month deal.
Musonda was promoted to first-team training earlier this month, but has grown frustrated over a lack of opportunities to play at Stamford Bridge.
